nodes.documentation:
* WalletSimple
============
 * Basic multi-signer wallet designed for use in a co-signing environment where 2 signatures are required to move funds.
Typically used in a 2-of-3 signing configuration. Uses ecrecover to allow for 2 signatures in a single transaction.
 * The first signature is created on the operation hash (see Data Formats) and passed to sendMultiSig/sendMultiSigToken
The signer is determined by verifyMultiSig().
 * The second signature is created by the submitter of the transaction and determined by msg.signer.
 * Data Formats
============
 * The signature is created with ethereumjs-util.ecsign(operationHash).
Like the eth_sign RPC call, it packs the values as a 65-byte array of [r, s, v].
Unlike eth_sign, the message is not prefixed.
 * The operationHash the result of keccak256(prefix, toAddress, value, data, expireTime).
For ether transactions, `prefix` is "ETHER".
For token transaction, `prefix` is "ERC20" and `data` is the tokenContractAddress.
 *
nodes.name: WalletSimple

nodes.documentation:
Set up a simple multi-sig wallet by specifying the signers allowed to be used on this wallet.
2 signers will be required to send a transaction from this wallet.
Note: The sender is NOT automatically added to the list of signers.
Signers CANNOT be changed once they are set
   * @param allowedSigners An array of signers on the wallet
nodes.name: WalletSimple
isSigner

nodes.documentation: Modifier that will execute internal code block only if the sender is an authorized signer on this wallet
nodes.name: onlySigner

nodes.documentation: Gets called when a transaction is received without calling a method

Create a new contract (and also address) that forwards funds to this contract
returns address of newly created forwarder address
nodes.name: createForwarder
sendMultiSig
sendMultiSigToken
flushForwarderTokens

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "in safe mode and to address is not a signer"

arguments.value: in safe mode and to address is not a signer

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "in safe mode and to address is not a signer"

nodes.name: verifyMultiSig

nodes.documentation: Irrevocably puts contract into safe mode. When in this mode, transactions may only be sent to signing addresses.
nodes.name: activateSafeMode
recoverAddressFromSignature

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "sequence id lower than the lowest value in the window"

arguments.value: sequence id lower than the lowest value in the window

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "sequence id lower than the lowest value in the window"

nodes.documentation:
Verify that the sequence id has not been used before and inserts it. Throws if the sequence ID was not accepted.
We collect a window of up to 10 recent sequence ids, and allow any sequence id that is not in the window and
greater than the minimum element in the window.
@param sequenceId to insert into array of stored ids
nodes.name: tryInsertSequenceId

nodes.documentation:
Gets the next available sequence ID for signing when using executeAndConfirm
returns the sequenceId one higher than the highest currently stored
nodes.name: getNextSequenceId
